document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Mediterranean species of Harmothoe Kinberg, 1856 Lagisca Malmgren, 1865 (Polychaeta: Polynoidae: Polynoinae) descriptions of a new genus and a new species

, pl. 3: fi gures 1-4, 6; ClapareÁde, 1868: 376, pl. 2: fi gure 4A -E.

, pl. 2: fi gure 3.

Harmothoe spinifera : Fauvel, 1923: 64
, fi gure 23f -l; Bellan, 1964a: 26 [part]; Campoy, 1982: 72; Tebble and Chambers, 1982: 28, fi gures 8, 30; Chambers and Muir, 1997: 110, fi gure 29.

Type material
.
Polynoe spinifera
, types probably lost;

, two slides with elytra and parapodia, probably from type material, MHNG 795, 796.

IG . 2. (A)
Harmothoe spinifera
( 26 March 1997 , Banyuls, SMF 9192/1): right cirrigerous parapodium of chaetiger 12; posterior view. (B -G)
Harmothoe antilopes
(St. 217
Urania CS
96). (B) Right cirrigerous parapodium of chaetiger 16; style of dorsal cirrus missing, chaetae not fi gured; posterior view; (C) notochaeta; (D) tip of same; (E) bidentate neurochaeta; (F) tip of same; (G) tip of unidentate neurochaeta (scales 5 250 M m for A; 500 M m for B; 250 M m for C, E; 50 M m for D, F, G).

.
. Ben-Eliahu, POLY 84, HUJ POLY 330.

Diagnosis .
Anterior pair of eyes beneath cephalic peaks. Elytra : margin smooth, surface covered by conical microtubercles. Dorsal and ventral tentacular cirri and dorsal cirri papillate, tapering subdistally to fi liform tip. IG . 3.
Harmothoe spinifera
(
26 March 1997
, Banyuls, SMF 9192 /1). (A) Anterior end; dorsal view; (B) right sixth elytron from chaetiger 11; (C) detail of posterior margin of same (scales 5 1 mm for A, B; 100 M m for C)
.

Description . Prostomium bilobed, with distinct cephalic peaks; median antenna with large ceratophore in anterior notch, style papillate, tapering subdistally to liform tip; lateral antennae with small ceratophores inserted ventrally and with short, papillate, tapering styles; palps smooth and tapering, longer than median antenna and tentacular cirri; anterior pair of eyes anteroventrally beneath cephalic peaks, posterior pair dorsally near hind margin. Tentaculophores inserted laterally

prostomium, each with one or two chaetae and a pair of papillate dorsal and ventral tentacular cirri, tapering subdistally to fi liform tip. Second segment with fi rst pair of elytra, biramous parapodia, and long ventral buccal cirri, similar to tentacular cirri (fi gure 3A).

Fifteen pairs of elytra; elytral margin smooth, surface covered by conical microtubercles (fi gure 3A -C); fi rst pair of elytra only slighly pigmented, second pair very dark, the following lighter, mottled brownish. Styles of dorsal cirri papillate, tapering subdistally to fi liform tip, extending beyond neurochaetae; styles of ventral cirri with few papillae, tapering, shorter than neuropodia (fi gure 2A).

Parapodia biramous, both rami with single aciculum penetrating epidermis; notopodia with short, rounded presetal and longer, pointed postsetal acicular lobe, neuropodia with subconical presetal acicular lobe with digitiform supra-acicular process and shorter rounded postsetal lobe. Notochaetae stouter than neurochaetae
gure 2A), with distinct rows of spines and blunt tips showing small incision; neurochaetae with distinct rows of spines only in distal part and bidentate tips with secondary tooth.

Measurements . Largest specimen found: L 17 mm ,
W 3.5
mm; specimen fi gured herein: L 10 mm , W 2 mm for 31 chaetigers (juvenile, only 14 pairs of elytra).
Distribution . Mediterranean Sea: Western Mediterranean, Adriatic and Aegean
